description:
Great sandwiches!  The Ray's special bagel (nonveg version especially), is an incredible deal.  They make their own bagels in house.  Honestly these bagels are way better than a lot of specialized bagel places.

The falafel is also outstanding, with or without chicken.  TBH, I'm not a huge fan of the chicken they use in their sandwiches - it's not bad, it's just nothing stand out.  But hey, for the price, you really can't go wrong whatever you choose.
author: Thomas R.

description:
I came here and ordered the vegan bagel (hummus, sun dried tomatoes and cucumbers). The price was great for SF, $3 - and the food was reasonable to tasty, but basically just normal food. I did get to wait over 20 minutes for someone to spread hummus onto a bagel for me, which was not very fun.

I'll be sure to come back next time I'm in the mood to wait an unreasonable amount of time for regular food. Also on the deli counter said NY bagels, but they tasted like SF bagels to me :/
author: David L.

description:
My husband and I frequent this neighborhood market whenever we're up for a  Giant sandwhich made to order, and their homemade hummus is also a fav. 
 They are hands down
 the best deli in the Mission District
 and I'd go as far as saying 
the entire city!
 Mm so mouth watering delish!
author: Erica C.

description:
THE WAIT: On a Sunday around 1:30pm, there were a few orders ahead of us, and three of us waited 15-20 minutes for our sandwiches. On a Wednesday at noon, I waited 5-10 minutes for my Special Bagel (first in line). 

* The Falafel - 4 stars
Love the toasted lavash wrap. The falafel is fresh & moist, and the flavors are great. FYI - if you get this spicy, it is legit SPICY. 

* Ray's Special Bagel (Vegan) $2.95 - 4.5 stars
Delicious! Excellent hummus, fresh ingredients, fantastic deal. Only downside is it doesn't count towards the 10-sandwich punch card.

Another time I ordered the Richmond (a Ruben), only to find out when I got home and unwrapped the sandwich that it was the Sunset. Not bad but just not what I was excited for. 

* The Sunset - 3.5 stars
Chicken was moist, good flavor, but bread was dry.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
This place has the best sandwiches in the Mission! Whenever I'm lazy and don't want to trek too far to get food, R Image Market is my go to place! I conveniently live 2 minutes walking distance from this market, which is why I'm always coming here to pick up food or a bottle of wine. 

So far I've tried the Chicken Pesto & Salami Sandwich. Both are equally good, especially if you order it with dutch crutch bread! I'll have to come back to try the Pastrami Sandwich since it also seems pretty popular here. The sandwiches here are also reasonably price (about $7-8 for a sandwich) and great quality!

I can see why this place has raving reviews and is a neighborhood favorite!
author: MyTien P.

description: I love their salads! They're delicious, filling, and at a great price. The falafel salad has really tasty falafels, baba ganoush, and avocados. I also had the Greek salad with chicken breast, which had to be the tastiest chicken breast I've ever had! Will definitely keep coming back.
author: Dan B.

description: This place is the best for sandwiches and salads.  I love their Greek salad, Italian sub, and for breakfast Ray does bacon, avocado, cream cheese bagels with his spicy pepper spread!  Super good!
author: Jeff H.

description:
Been coming here for Ray's Sandwich Counter for 5 years now.  Gave it 5 stars then, now I wish I could give them six.  Consistency, Quality, Taste, Value... they have it all.
There is even a loyalty program for a free sandwich after you buy 10
My go to:  Hot Pastrami on toasted Rye, melted Muenster Cheese, Garlic Aioli, extra Pickles.
Go off hours and enjoy the limited outdoor seating.   Calling in your order 20 minutes in advance is also beneficial.
author: John W.

description:
The people and the solid selection of healthy foods made me visit this market way more than I probably needed to. The falafel salad is amazing, the fresh produce is great, Ray's special breakfast bagel is delicious, and Fady is the man. 

If you're in the area and need something, this is the place to go.
author: Mak K.

description:
Absolutely delicious sandwiches made by Ray. Consistent flavor THROUGHOUT and not a single piece of the sandwich falling apart. If that's not a masterpiece I really don't know what is??? Not to mention, it's so delicious and not too heavy if you have a drink and some chips with it. Also, Ray is a stand up type of guy. Real chill dude. Perhaps a little intimidating to me but he seemed to get along just fine with my boyfriend who said "Thanks boss" as we left, ha ha.

What we ordered:
- Hot Pastrami w/ Melted Muenster Cheese, Garlic Aioli, Lettuce, Tomato, Pickle, & Jalapenos on a Whole Wheat Roll (this was as per some Yelper's review and I loved it!) (~$8 - $9)
-Turkey w/ Tomato, Lettuce, Pickle, & Jalapenos on a Whole Wheat Roll (~$8 - $9)

Tips: 
- WHOLE WHEAT ROLLS JUST DO IT. it's so good
- Order ahead by calling, or you'll have to wait a good 10 minutes :( 
- Grab some boojee chips from the market to eat with your sandwiches :)
- There's some seating outside but it's limited and v casual if you're into that. If you're not, it's definitely more of a TO-GO spot

the TL;DR
Food  (5/5)
Ambiance (2.5/5) It was nice out, we sat on those picnicky tables outside. it was chill; twas whatevs; not even considering this very much cus what do you expect from a casual sandwich deli shop
Service (4/5)
author: Sara S.

description:
Just finished one the very most enjoyable Reubens I've ever had. And I had to wait quite a while for it to be constructed: and it was more than worth the wait.

The market itself is nicely and broadly stocked with lots of organic options and things yuppies like to buy.
author: lance l.

description: My Saturday hangover sandwich go-to spot. SO good! If you love deli sandwiches you will love Ray's.
author: Rebecca L.

description: One of the best falafel sandwiches I've had in a while! Delicious, tahini-filled falafel wrap, with lots of cucumber, tomato, and greens. Was exactly what I was looking for - and such a good deal. It was a ginormous wrap for only $8!
author: Jacinda Z.

description:
Ray is an incredibly friendly and dedicated neighborhood small business owner. For years I have bought sandwiches at R Image, and every time am reminded why I will travel across the city to come here. 
 
Definitely a must if you like deli sandwiches with all the fixins. Ray is always cooking up different sides like hummus, season croutons, etc, but my favorite is his special sandwich spread. Try it next time you're in the Mission -- you will not be disappointed!
author: Marsha M.

description: Excellent comer store - Ray and his team really put energy into meeting the changing needs of their clientele and being a part of the fabric of the neighborhood. They also make outstanding sandwiches that people come from all over town to enjoy. Ray's hummus is the best!
author: Julie L.

description:
Great sandwiches, great prices .. friendly staff. Located right by Philz so you can grab a coffee and a sandwich. 
I'm not positive but I think most things from the deli are organic as well.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I've spent over 11 years of my life in San Francisco, and so far this place consistently makes the best deli sandwiches I've had in the city.  I think it comes down to a combination of factors:  the bread is always super fresh and softer than at most delis, they use quality ingredients (boar's head meats, homemade hummus and falafel, etc.), and Ray's Mix.  Ray's Mix is a mixture of different herbs and spices, along with a little bit of finely-chopped red onion and pickled jalapeño.  Not enough to be spicy, but enough to add some great flavor.  There's nothing bland here.  They also have an exhaustive selection of beverages, including some that are difficult to find elsewhere in SF.  Overall, highly recommended.  I only wish I had discovered this place sooner.

My tip:  try the sesame roll on whatever sandwich you're getting.  I got it once because it was one of the few rolls they had left after an especially busy lunch rush, and it wound up becoming my new favorite.
author: Miles B.

description: Great sandwiches here - Ray is super helpful and can suggest good additions, and everything's always super tasty. Highly recommend the deli.
author: Peter H.

description: I'm so glad this place hasn't changed since I moved to this neighborhood 5ish years ago. Great staff, sandwiches hot and cold, crazy good selection of beer, and just about any staple of a grocery store can be found here.
author: Henry T.

description: Love ray&crew. Order the falafel salad (so good!)  and enjoy. Seriously, friendliest corner store ever. They've got what you need :)
author: alicia l.

description:
This corner market has everything!

So yeah, basically this one small store manages to stock a huge selection of quality booze and yet still has room for every other thing you could possibly want to eat, all at good prices... and you can get the best sandwich ever while you shop.  If you live nearby, you need to be shopping here.

The details:

Reasonably priced and really good wine. (Try the CarMenAir or the Gascon Malbec!)

A large selection of microbrewery beers.

Healthy/organic grocery staples at the same prices you'd see at a larger store, or less. (Brands like Amy's, Lundberg, Bob's Mill, Mary's crackers, etc.)  This is the kind of place that had Seitan in the freezer, ten kinds of organic soy/rice/coconut milk, organic butter and cheese, quinoa, Adel's sausages, kale chips, etc.  You could probably do about half your grocery shopping here without missing out.

The bagels are delivered fresh from The Bagelry a few times a week. 

The Felafel wraps here are some of the best in the city.  The house made hummus and babaganoush in the deli case is possibly the best I've ever tasted.  

The breakfast bagel sandwiches are such a good deal and so delicious.  They are made to order and you can get an egg and cheese bagel or lox and cream cheese. The best thing is to get a cup of coffee at phills and then come to Ray's for a bagel sandwich, and eat it outside at the little table.

You might think from this description that this is an upscale gourmet market for yuppies.  But actually the vibe is totally down to earth and lots of people shop here from all walks of life.  They accept EBT.  There are a range of prices and products with lots of really inexpensive staple foods available.  

Ray is such a nice and funny guy, always joking and making everyone feel welcome.  The rest of the staff is awesome too.  It is very stable, with the same employes there for the long haul.  

As far as I can tell, everyone who works there speak both Spanish and English fluently, and I see many local Spanish speaking people from the neighborhood shopping here.  Several of the staff speak Arabic too, and there are some nice Middle Eastern/Mediterranean specialty foods on the shelves as well. Just when I think I've browsed everything they have, I find some new little treasure.  Justin's nut butters.  Dad's cardamom flavor ice cream.  Blue Bottle Gelatto Popsicles. Just Desserts Carrot Cake.  House made rice pudding. I could go on and on, but really you should just go see for yourself.

This really is the place!
author: katie s.

description:
CAREFUL
I live in the neighborhood and I buy snacks here all the time and I like their deli too until I just noticed that all the snacks I bought today are out of date, and I checked on the beverages I bought yesterday,  yas the same. I think they selling out of date food all the time and despite of all those I bought I ate all this time, not going again.
author: Connie W.

description:
Since when do corner stores make sandwiches, have a huuuge selection of decently priced vino (for a city convenient store) carry local organic cheese, cream, & relatively good looking produce?!
WOW! 
Let's be frank, it's a convenience store but a great one at that.
author: Ashley G.

description: Man this guy really knows how to make a sanduich!!! I was at Philz Coffe and asked where I could buy some sanduichs for lunch - the guy at philz highly recommended the market at the corner. Best recommendation ever! Awesome!
author: Santiago E.

description:
These sandwiches are SOOOO BOMB. They hook it up with like a 15" for 12 bucks. It's enough for two meals. You literally can't go wrong with the menu. 

Don't go once, don't go twice, go until you've tried every sandwich they make.  Rhamsy puts something extra in there I swear. It tastes soooo good.
author: Che B.

description: My favorite sandwich shop. Make sure Ray is working (he usually is) when you go. Try getting a custom sandwich and tell Him what kind of things you like, he'll help you decide and turn your sandwich into a masterpiece of glory-food.
author: Kevin F.

description: Raymond made my sandwich with such love and care. I had to text my husband and say "I'm eating the best sandwich I've had a while". The plantain chips by the register are also amazing.
author: Amanda S.

description: Staff has always been pretty rude and/or just plain void of human emotion. Today Ray called to tell me that I ordered from the app incorrectly and condescendingly told me he didn't get what was so hard because "it's very simple." Ok, so I'm an idiot. Thank you for making sure I knew. But your sandwiches aren't good enough for your staff to have such an aloof, entitled attitude. This place is convenient and that's about the only reason we ever go. From now on, I'll wait in line for a Rhea's where they use fresh bread and actually care about their customers. If you're headed to Precita, hit up Precita Park Cafe or the market on Folsom across from the park. Skip this place.
author: Danielle F.

description:
I came here one day for lunch on my relentless quest for the best falafel sandwich in SF. It kept popping up every time I would search for falafel places in the area. It was even named "Best Falafel" by some n00b. 

I say "n00b" because this isn't even in the top ten falafel wraps in SF. Then again, I like the frozen falafel from TJ's so maybe I'm the n00b... The falafel itself lacked flavor as did the hummus. I won't say it's the worst I've had but I will never try it again. It's the only Vegan sandwich they make at the deli counter. There are several Vegetarian options if that's your thing. About the only thing going for it is the sandwich was cheap, around $5 or so. 

As for the convenience store side of things it's actually a pretty decent corner store. Well stocked with unexpired items that just so happen to be brand name. It's decidedly less sketchy than the other options in the neighborhood.
author: John B.

description:
Couldn't ask for a better corner market! 

Great wine and beer selection, amazing sandwiches, fresh produce, wide variety of groceries (organic, ethnic, healthy, unhealthy options) AND the best staff ever. Seriously they are so friendly, makes this place a perfect 10.
author: Maile S.

description: I would love to rate them 5 - stars but the only saving grace is the female employee that is therr sometimes. I've lived in the neighborhood for the last 4 years and have yet to receive welcoming customer service. Ray instead of handing me the sandwich I order tossed it at me. I guess 1-2 sandwiches plus groceries doesn't add up to much. Maybe I'll try again another time. Rude 90% of the time
author: John P.

description: Finally went in here after far too long. Ordered a turkey and cheese with everything included Ray's special mix ... Holy crap this is a good sandwich! I will be coming back. Soon!
author: Daniel W.

description:
Very lucky to have Ray's next door!
Sandwiches are delicious and affordable, also highly recommend the hummus
author: Joe M.

description: What a pleasure to shop here! Quality product, WONDERFUL folks and classic, delicious, made to order sandwiches (and other house made goodies too). Ray is a true gem - knowledgeable, talented, humorous and graceful. He's the type of San Franciscan that makes this town a special place to be.
author: Richard B.

description: Meh. Ordered the Reuben. They soaked the bun in sauce and very little pastrami. Maybe they had a new girl or something I dunno
author: James C.

description: Little corner store with an awesome deli. I don't like roast beef but the roast beef here is super delicious - all their sandwiches are. Ray customizes exactly to your preferences and has awesome recommendations. Also everything is very affordable. Can grab drinks and snacks to go along with the sandwich. I get lunch here 3/4 times a week because it's so good!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
This market has single-handedly sustained myself and my roommates on extremely hungover or lazy days since I have started living around the corner.  The sandwiches are delicious (vegetarian options as well!) and the snacks/ice cream can be on the "healthier" side if needed ;)  

Friendliest guys & great food.  So glad I live so close!
author: Raina D.

description: Not a falafal expert but the deli counter makes a great one. Pair that with the fresh hummus on one of their wraps and you have a lunch sensation. Fairly priced and a great little market. To tell yhe I was just passing through S.F. on the 101 and had to pull off freeway navagate towsrd the mission district just to get a great wrap. Well worth the side trip.
author: Richard H.

description: Their greek salad is delicious. Make sure to add in extra time for waiting for your order!
author: Daviena C.

description:
I don't do (read: i don't write) reviews, so when I do, you know it's for a good reason.  I just stopped in here to grab a falafel sandwich, after my cousin mentioned there was another good falafel shop nearby.  I'm a HUGE middle eastern fan, so falafel, hummus, these things are my key words.  Naturally, I ended up there today and was so impressed.
Ray mans the counter, he's awesome. Offered me an assortment of extra goodies on my sandwich and even gave me some hummus samplings as I waited.  I also spied him handing out some free candy to little visitors while there.  That's what a neighborhood spot is about!
Just super friendly, super good and clearly good characters to support. Go get your falafel, or whatever other sandwich makes you melt.
author: Courtney K.

description: Delicious Sandwiches and wraps! Ray is a great person and it was nice to chat with him! Affordable! Delicious and great!
author: Ksenia D.

description:
I come here for the vegan falafel wrap.  I started getting it because of its good Yelp reviews, and feel like it's a good, BIG meal, for a reasonable price.  Especially a great alternative to the abundance of Mexican food in my neighborhood.

I like to call in my order then come pick it up.  The service here is excellent, which makes me happy to give them my business.

The market has some good products that are hard to find in most markets of the neighborhood.  (like gluten-free crackers, healthy beverages, good wines, cheeses)
author: Carolyn N.

description: This is my second time eating here. The first time I had a roast beef sandwich on Dutch crunch and this time I had the Bernal Heights. It. Was. Fuckin delicious!! If you're looking for good sandwich spot, this place is a must try. Roxy's is hard to top, but this place is pretty damn close to it. I've tried to save my second half of the sandwich, but I couldn't resist and ate the whole damn thing! It's that delicious!
author: Jason E.

description:
I love, love, LOVE Ray's sandwiches!  I get one every chance I get, which is often, because I'm a Bernal Heights native.  Ray's mix is delicious and the pastrami is to die for.  Ray himself is a great guy, too.

Highly recommended for anyone in the neighborhood looking for a great sandwich!
author: Alice B.

description: Hmmnmmm what's all the brag about this place , my roast beef was very normal just like any deli you buy it and it sits there for a week in the fridge....  so when I saw other reviews like George's comparing a class place to a corner market I thought something really special so I drove down there so exexcited to eat this to die for sandwich. Ahhhhh what a joke . Please reviewers be real when you write a review whether you a family member or not , we actually read and take your recommendation.
author: Sue K.

description: Great sandwich and far from hipsters. I got the pastrami with avocado on wheat bread. Very fresh tasting and I couldn't finish all of it! I'm not a small person either. Its actually a liquor store with a deli booth but I enjoyed it. Seating available outside. Prices reasonable. $6.50 for a fully loaded sandwich. I will be coming here again after my Philz runs.
author: D. T.

description: So I went to this market 5 times in the last 2 days while on vacation in San Francisco. The service was always very friendly and the conversation with Ray was great. A few times while in the store people ordered sandwiches and I knew I had to get one. As we left town back home I got a twin peeks sandwich it was delicious and I could only eat half it was so big (and shortly after breakfast). After 10 hours north on I-5 we got to are next stop and ordered the worst Chinese food ever. As I sat in the hotel hungry I remembered I had the other side of my sandwich in the car. It was just as good if not better. RAY HAD SAVED ME!! When I go back to visit my friends in San Francisco I will be extremely excited for the next sandwich.
author: Jason F.

description:
Still THE BEST corner store in SF.

Once again, I returned to Ray's after a long absence- 3 years this time, once again with a totally new haircut, and ONCE again Ray and his staff all remembered my name and greeted me when I walked in.

Even though he was on the phone, Ray stopped talking to say hi and chat with me. 

Grabbed a Sioux City Sarsaparilla from his killer selection of unique sodas and beers and popped the top off on the bottle opener at the front door.

The fact that I will drive several miles and ignore all the other corner stores along the way should tell you that this place is awesome. Great sandwiches and other homemade food, great selection and the friendliest owner and staff in town bar none.
author: Pink F.

description:
You don't really expect to find great sandwiches from a corner store. This place easily has a better sandwich than many cafes I've been to.

The guy who runs this place, Ray, is really friendly and if you come often enough, he'll remember your order. I like that I can just pick up other things I need, like chips and drinks or general groceries, while he works on my order and then I can take it all to the counter for a great budget meal.

He's got a great variety of ingredients to choose from, including some meats which you usually don't see in ordinary cafes, and he does falafels too. I haven't tried the latter, though.

I took off a star because sometimes this place gets really busy and since it's just one guy working the sandwich stand, it can take a while just to get your order in. I suggest that you call in your order so that you don't have to wait so long during the lunchtime rush. Also, because Ray has to work on multiple sandwiches at a time, sometimes he forgets a thing here or there in your order. If you call in, at least he'll have it written down and won't forget.
author: Allen C.

description: Ray, Ramsey and the rest of the staff at this market are so friendly!  My husband and I eat at least one of their sandwiches each week-- delicious!
author: Lisa T.

description:
This is the best corner store in San Francisco. 

Ray, the guy who runs this place, has everything for all kinds of people. Healthy food, snacks, and fancy stuff too. 

One time I was craving some legit meat. He's got sopressata! One time I was craving good ass cheese. He's got goat cheese. 

He's got Annie's Mac N Cheese, and other healthy foods. Gluten free stuff. One time I was super sick and I got instant miso soup. It was so awesome, and healthier than friggin cup-o-noodles.

He's seriously got everything. From fresh fruit to local stuff.

Best part: The Deli. The best deli sandwich in a 5 block radius, maybe more. Whatever you do, get Ray's Mix on your sandwich and you will understand what I'm talking about. All of his classics are great but his Smothered Chicken sandwich is to die for. 

Only downside is he closes earlier than I'd like.

I've got a corner store half a block away from me and I always walk the extra block to get to his store.
author: Meredith S.

description:
This place has amazing sandwiches. I've been living under the sadly misinformed belief that a good sandwich in the Mission was hard to come by. LIttle did I know this gem of sandwichery was so close. But a few blocks from my humble door step.

I ride my bike past all the time, and decided to stop in on the way out of the city for a day of hiking in Point Reyes. It's a full market, too, so it was perfect for grabbing supplies before heading out. 

We got an extra sandwich for the hike, which was equally delicious as the one I ate in the car on the way. The chicken pesto is awesome. I'll be eating it on a regular basis from now on. The pastrami is also really tasty. Well priced, too. The bill was about 20 bucks for three sandwiches and drinks. 

Eat here. All the time. You'll be happy.
author: Elias A.

description: I am soo happy to have R Image as my corner store. Ray makes it work it, especially his LOVE MUFFINS, made fresh only on Saturdays, best breakfast and for the right price. His sandwiches are also amazing and he brings so much to every visit i have there!!!
author: Margey D.

description:
Best sandwiches near 24th St. BART! I love Ray's!

This store epitomizes my conceptualization of the local corner store:
- family run (Ray and family)
- fresh made, large portion sandwiches for the budget inclined
- craft beer, more than basic wine selection, & tons of different juices, sodas, etc.
- some fresh fruits/veggies and deli cooler w/ olives, potato salad and such
- legit chip selection
- great hours (open early and late)

My go-to sandwiches are Chicken Basil, Chicken Pesto and the Pastrami. Can't go wrong with the Falafel (super-sized and tasty) either. 

Ray seems to know about everybody that comes in his store. His authentic dedication to providing a great sandwich and building community through his store is what kept me coming back. Don't miss out on making this your corner store!
author: Benjamin W.

description:
We used to live just a half block away from this market and these guys were always really good to us.  
From the outside, it looks like a kindof ~meh~ cornerstore that's going to have booze and a section of expired dairy products.  
Inside, you'll realize that Ray, the owner, knows his audience.
This is a cornerstore that meets the needs of all those who make up the mission including the organic foodies.  
The sandwiches are delicious.  I had the same sandwich several times a week (caprese wrap) for most of my maternity leave and did not get sick of it At All.  I would eat one right now if I could (alas, we recently moved from the mission).
author: Emily W.

description:
R Image is the best... even though, what's up with that name? Weird and awesome. Anyway, owner Ray is a super great dude, who makes his sandwiches with a secret ingredient. (Hint: it's love.) His specialty is the falafel, so I recommend trying that at least once. He makes his own baba ghannouj, and will often offer you a taste test when he's perfecting a batch. 

I'm a spicy food kinda broad, so when I'm feeling like adding a few pounds to my midsection, I opt for the Chicken Chipotle sandwich. This tomatoey, smokey delight is chock-full of grilled chicken, onions, and basil, and served warm with melted pepper jack. If you're not one for heat, beware: your tongue may need a fire extinguisher. For me, though, it's perfect!

As far as convenience stores go, I'd say it's mighty convenient.
author: Christina S.

description:
Ray, thanks for coming to my rescue when I am running late for work and still haven't had lunch. 
Did you know you can call in orders to this store!? I've done it at least 10 times. They take my order, I run in and pay with a quickness and off I go, onward with my day. 
I like the cozy home-style deli that they have in here. Ray is always putting little extras on my sandwich, like fresh basil, and I love it. 
As long as I am in the neighborhood, R Image is my deli.
author: Kelly B.

description:
This is my spot! Only a few doors from my cribb. Love their subs:

Ham Sub, dutch crunch, fresh mozzarella cheese!
author: Hector M.

description:
Just met Ray today

Very friendly guy, he made me the best falafel sandwich, fresh and delicious!
Will be back again.
author: Mario M.

description: I've ordered here several times. I've had the meatball, the Reuben, and the wharf. They were all great. This is a small friendly market where you can grab everything you need and a great sandwich all at once. The staff is friendly and will recognize you if you return. They always have a game on and though it's packed full of groceries and often customers, it's comfortable. Don't be annoyed if you have to wait a bit for your grub. They are busy and they take care to make each sandwich delicious to order. The ingredients are quality and fresh and worth the wait. Enjoy!
author: Justin D.

description: Cheap, fresh, delicious sandwiches. What else could a former college student on a working professional's budget ask for? This place is fantastic, besides the typical parking issues of the Mission. Since it is a market, there are lots of groceries to choose to accompany your sandwich selection. I usually get the veggie sandwich, which includes, lots of avocado slices, sprouts, spinach, etc. It's a little less than $6 and is HUGE! Most of the time I can't finish it, and can save it for later. They take cash and card, and give you the option to get cash back. This place is awesome, and I keep coming back.
author: Nancy R.

description:
Such nice people, clean place and the prices aren't too much higher than at larger grocery stores, basically just a convenience tariff. 
They have a good beer selection and the sandwiches are nice as well.
author: Charlie H.

description:
I might never get a deli sandwich anywhere else again.  The bread is perfectly toasted, soft and flaky.  I'm not sure exactly what sandwich I had because I asked them to make whatever they thought I should try.  Turkey, swiss, and some amazing sauce.  If you've ever been to a Michael's Sourdough - this even beats out that. 

Also, it was BIG so I saved half in the fridge.  It sat in the fridge for a whole day, and when I ate the leftovers I swear it was even better. (Don't ask me how.)  Plus for a little convenience store they have some quality items that you won't find at the standard corner shop (especially in the Mission.)  Staff is always super friendly - I think this store makes the neighborhood.  Love it.
author: Mary Jane B.

description:
This place is so epic and low key that I want to give it 1 star to keep it that way. But I can't deny the sheer perfection that is the R Image deli and corner store. Clearly I am not alone. 

Here's what you do on those beautiful spring afternoons: grab your sandwich with Rays homemade relish, get a couple tall cans and some chips, and hike up Folsom to the top of bernal hill. Upon reaching the peak, you're already voracious appetite will have increased 10-fold thanks to the beastly hill you just conquered. Find a shady spot in the grass where you can take in the view and share some brewskies with the homies. This is the life. 

R Image, you make dreams come true. I love you guys. Don't forget that the service is bar none. The guys who work here are some of the nicest in the city and I can't recommend it enough. 

One more thing: sandwiches are $4.50. 

What else do you need?
author: James R.

description:
Friendly service, and an inventive and delicious sandwich totally added to my post-work, bizarrely-sunny-for-SFafternoon walk to Bernal hill euphoria. 

Maybe it was the lovingly made to order salami sandwich with chopped fresh garlic, or the stunning vista out over the bay as the sun sank between twin peaks, or some combination of both.  Either way R Image helped make my afternoon perfect. 

The price is so right too.
author: Jane F.

description: This rating is solely on their sandwich. Their sandwich was filling enough and flavorful. It is also at a decent price.
author: Charles Z.

description:
What a remarkable little shop, tucked away in a residential pocket at 25th & Folsom! The owner and his staff here are fabulous and very friendly. Whenever I'm in a bind and need my fix of energy drinks, toilet paper or Ben & Jerry's ice cream (way cheaper than your typical supermarket), I head straight here. I haven't yet sampled the legendary sandwiches, but every time I visit there's a line of hungry bromigos waiting to order one - they must be good. 

The moment my digestive system finishes processing the El Farolito burrito currently lodged in my intestinal tract, I'll have room to tackle the beast that is R Image Market's sandwich.
author: Kat F.

description:
I finally walked that extra half mile from work, and hot damn, it was worth it!

(+) The falafel wrap was lunch-tastic! (clearly a made-up word). 

This is proper falafel, with very flavorful dressings all slathered inside.  Ordering it "spicy with onions" was a good decision.

(+) Only 5 bucks.

(-) None. But I can't go up to 5 stars on one visit.

THE BOTTOM LINE:

(+) I won't be getting lunch at Charlie's or The Park Bench anytime soon.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Super nice convenience store. I have better luck finding things to eat here than I do at Safeway. Huge selection of really tasty bottled beverages, snacks, and even a small produce area.

Like the rest of the reviewers say, the sandwiches are to die for. I can't believe how generous they are for the price.
author: Jenny B.

description: Obsessed. Have lived around the corner for years and have grown to love Ray and his family. Such a reliable corner store and an incredible deli. Ray has groomed his business to perfection and I appreciate that he is alwaus trying to make the place better. Definetely a neighborhood gem.
author: Ivy M.

description: My favorite market in the Mission is this small corner store which is packed with a great wine and beer selection, organic snacks and now even fresh produce -- not to mention the awesome sandwiches! It reminds me of a few places I grew up going to in NJ where you get a huge sandwich for little cost. Also, the potato salad is amazing.
author: Priscilla M.

description: This is a convenient neighborhood store that makes a pretty mean meatbal marinara sub. The other sandwiches are good too, but it can take a minute sometimes before you get your food in hand.
author: Vivek N.

description:
Ray's is an awesome neighborhood spot.
Great sandwiches, you might have to wait a few minutes though. I usually get the chicken pesto.
They have a variety of food and beer/wine, and there's always a special on something if you're looking to save a few bucks.
Also, everyone working here is awesome. The more you go, the more you feel like part of the family.
5 stars fools!
author: Jake C.

description:
I joined Yelp strictly to review R Image Market and give Ray and the guys the 5 stars they deserve! If you are in the mood for a sandwich, this is the place to go. Ray and all the guys are quick to acknowledge me by name every time I visit. The store itself has a pretty good selection of cheeses and wines, an added bonus to such a great neighborhood corner store.

Love coming here regularly - if not daily.

Thanks Ray!
author: Laura H.

description: I LOVE this place. Not only is it my corner store for essentials, they make fantastic hummus and falafel. The staff are all incredibly friendly, the beer selection is good and they even sell recycled paper towels. What more can I say?
author: Mark H.

description: While I love Deli Board, Rhea's & Ike's....I always have to get 4 sando's for the household.  It's a bit heavy on the wallet.  R Image is right there with these shops for half the price.  And they have an awesome falafel wrap.  I love this place and they are some good peeps in there.  The Chicken Chipotle is a winner!!  The pastrami ain't bad either.  I am a sandwich hoe!! Thank you
author: Ramon L.

description: Ray is magic. Pastrami on Dutch Crunch? Bow chicka bow wow. Meatball wrap? Marry me. Everything here is DELICIOUS. Definitely the best sandwich place I've tried in the Mission. Rhea's Deli's got nothing on Ray.
author: Sabrina V.

description: Love, love, love this place! Amazing sandwiches, extremely generous portions for the price and an incredibly friendly staff. Will definitely be back!
author: Jennifer C.

description: The falafel wrap here is absolutely delicious and you get so much food for what you pay. Stopping by at Ray's is an excellent choice.
author: Anna W.

description:
Delivers on the sandwich hype.

Yelpers love this Mission hidden gem. Now I do too. Five bucks gets you a packed sandwich on your choice of bread with all the fixings.

Grilled chicken. Spinach. Tomato. Pickles. Wheat roll. Hint of basil at the suggestion of the nice guy making my lunch.  

Brilliant. Well priced. Now go find it too.
author: Jason B.

description: As good as a sandwich gets , boarshead , amazing bread and great prices , much better that overrated ike's
author: NAEL K.

description: Amazing sandwiches. Great, fast and friendly service. The market has a great beer selection as well.
author: Matthew R.

description:
This might just be the best corner market in San Francisco -- it's certainly the best one in the Mission. Prices for off-the-shelf goods are not as high as typical liquor stores (although still more than the supermarket). They've got a real selection of groceries -- not just junk food -- and the deli sandwiches are amazing. For $4.50, you get an enormous sub. Get everything on it, especially the homemade onion relish. Cheese will cost you another fifty cents.

You can also buy decent whole bean coffee and grind it in the store for $10/pound. And they have kombucha. 

Plus, Ray, the owner, makes his own hummus. It's a bit lemony for my taste, but the consistency is perfect. I haven't tried his falafel sandwich yet, but I've seen a friend eat one and been jealous.
author: Tarin T.

description: Best sandwich place in the mission. It's my goto spot along-side El Farolito when I'm hungry for a delicious no-frills meal. The chicken chipotle sandwich is amazing. And the sauce is hand made by the owner, Raymond, who is the chillest possible human being. Also try the hot pastrami, and I hear there are good cheeses if you're into that.
author: Kevin G.

description:
You know those little "frequent eater" cards that so many small sandwich shops give out? This is the only store where I have ever actually finished one. 
R Image has some really tasty sandwiches, and at $4.50 they are pretty much the best price to performance sandwich shop in town. The store is clean, well lit and pleasant to hang around in as you chat with the owner while he makes your sandwich. Two big thumbs up.
author: Harry P.

description: what can I say..this is my all time favorite sandwhich shop in the city! Not only is Ray personable and friendly, but is down right genius. Serving up the freshest and mostly homemade goods, it's hard to ever go wrong here. He can even improv if you tell him "I'm in the mood for something meaty and cheesy" and then BAM..5 minutes later you has his San Francisco version of a cheeseteak. Meat eaters and vegetarians alike come to rays for a quick fix of delisciousness all for moderate prices. Love it.
author: Selvi H.

description: This market has really great sandwiches. I was in the mood for an old fashioned turkey and cheese sandwich and it was amazing asking someone at a coffee shop for a recommendation and being directed to exactly what I was looking for. The bread was soft and thick, everything tasted fresh and the garlic mayo sauce they used made it special. The sandwich was $5 too, great deal. Perfecto.
author: Robin S.

description: Recommended by my FB friend John. Had the Hot Pastrami on a wheat roll with all the fixing including the owner Ray's special sauce which was unreal. $5.50 what a deal!!! Had pasta salad which was good also. Ray made my sandwich and as pointed out in other reviews, what a nice friendly man. We had a great conversation and you can bet!!! I'll be back..Thanks again,  Ray.. Glad I found your place.
author: Tyler K.

description: I had a delicious chicken pesto sandwich on dutch with garlic spread, jalapeño-onion mix, and mozzarella... toasted. Yum.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I didn't eat here, never have. But this afternoon, I was squeezing my trusty 99 Sub For into the spot in front of this store, trying to not be in the red hydrant zone. Got out to check- too much red curb. Backed up some more, don't want to hit the car behind me. Young cutie comes out, wearing deli guy garb: (you are going to think I'm lying) "do you want to trade places?" he has the car behind me. "Oh no, I'll only be a little while" says I. "How long" "15 min" "I'll watch it for you"  My hero comes out of the store w/ a piece of paper AND a pen, "give me your number and I'll call if there's a problem".  Done. For those that don't know me- I'm a 50+lesbian, so we weren't really flirting. But I love this deli and I love the guy.  That kind of chivalry just must be noted.
author: victoria c.

description:
Ray and his crew are less a market and more a family to me.  Having lived 1/2 a block away for 3 years, I have been in and out of this store on a daily basis.  I can not express enough how much I value and hold them to heart.  They have such amazing sandwiches, the falafel reigns king, But, despite their undeniable ability to tastily fill my belly, they have walked heavy items to my house for me, helped me move by giving me boxes and in general, have always been very concerned over my well-being.  You are getting so much more than a market, you are getting a friend and even at times, a confidant.  

Ray, I'll miss you in San Jose!!!!
author: Lisa P.

description: Just discovered their new Falafel salad- best I've ever had! Ray's falafels are always on point- delish!!
author: Judith A.

description:
This is a great store that is pretty much a community service. The owner is so awesome. He's fixed up the shop to be really pretty, light, clean, and welcoming, and it has a good range of food at decent prices for a corner store.  While it is awesome, it doesn't give off the horrible feel of gentrification. It's just a good corner store with a little capital behind it and a lot of regular effort put in to making it nice.

The sandwiches are great, and only $4.50.  I just asked for a turkey sandwich with everything but the kitchen sink, and it's hellishly perfect, with lots of turkey, provolone, fresh baby spinach, avocado, tomato, onion, pickles, pepperoncini peppers, and jalapenos.   Throw in an apple and a pack of cookies and I had a beautiful lunch for 6 dollars.

I'm having a little fantasy of spending a day liveblogging about the store and whoever comes in, plus interviewing Ray for his thoughts on what it's like to run the corner store.
author: Liz H.

description: Loved how Ray makes my turkey/ham and roast beef sandwich. Reasonable prices, not only on sandwiches but also the stuff that you can get. Simple store but its freakin awesome.
author: Regine G.

description: All I can say is $6 for a great sandwich, soda and bag of chips! This is their combo price when you order their fully packed sandwiches! Ray has always been a good dude when you come in. I remember this corner store before he opened as a kid. He's done a great job on it.
author: Oscar S.

description: I'd heard good things about their deli sandwiches so finally stopped by. First off, the father and son behind the counter are so nice. The sandwich was delicious. We got a vegetarian sandwich with garlic sauce, avocado, basil, tomato, peppercini, cucumbers and cheese. It really hit the spot. They suggested the falafel for next time. They also have a good selection of basic groceries and an excellent wine and liquor selection (especially compared to other nearby liquor stores). They said they would be expanding the store with seating in the near future. Sandwich was only $4.50.
author: Emma S.

description:
ohhh emmm geee! 

The falafel was delish! for $5 with the spicy sauce. I fell in luv.

Can't wait to go this weekend to get one. 

Yummy in my Tummy!
author: Abcde Q.

description:
Cute corner bodega with some surprising products on offer:

- Tofutti Cuties! Yes, you can get these here, I kid you not
- Pork Cracklins! I don't eat pork (I'm assuming these are pork-related, but honestly I'm not sure), but they have a rather impressive multi-bag selection
- Tahitian Treat! The bf is from the Midwest and had been weaving stories of this crazy soda for a while, but this was my first time experiencing it in all its neon red glory in person
- Dice! Two for $1 (above the counter, 3 colors to choose from), perfect if you have an incomplete Monopoly set, or, uh, need to go roll 'em in Garfield Park across the street

On the not so surprising end, they have a decent selection of beer for a bodega - the usuals, plus Lost Coast and Racer 5 - just lovely!
author: Carla C.

description: The owner Ray is such a sweetheart! When I first moved into the neighborhood I wanted some snacks and a sandwich, Ray was very welcoming to both me and my son, and we have been coming to his store ever since! The Sandwiches are amazing, and reasonably priced. Ray and his staff are super duper friendly! If you're in the neighborhood stop by and grab a sandwich, good for your budget and even better for your tummy! = ) Definitely a 5 star business!
author: Irene N.

description: Top 3 deli in the city. Great staff. afforable wine varietals . Ray runs a good ship . This is hands down of all places that Ive lived , the best local corner store.
author: Paul P.

description: what can i say. this guy knows how to make a sandwich. my favorite one is the falafel wrap extra spicy then the meatball then the pastrami then the salami and so one. you can't go wrong on any one of them. then there's the price. 5-7$ depending if you want extra meat or not.  the sandwiches are as big as your face. bang for you buck....oh and let me not forget about the awesome hummus. get into the hummus. they make it there. i think ray is Palestinian. well the palestinians make the best hummus.  i go all the time. you should to. only draw back he takes him time making them so order ahead or wait about 10minutes for one.
author: george robert v.

description:
This place is GREAT! 
Went in for a water, went out with a delicious Turkey sandwich and a cool water bottle on a warm San Francisco day. I'll be coming here again, thank you Ray.
author: David A.

description: This is my favorite store close to home.  I can get just about everything there in one stop!!!   The hummus and sandwiches are good and filling.  Everyone working there always has a smile and addresses my name.  I recommend stopping by for a sandwich if you are in the Mission area!!
author: gayle w.

description: Always a  friendly spot. Ask for a homemade sandwich and you won't be disapointed.  I go for a triple meat, roast beef, pastrami, and salami, it's a little extra money, but worth it.
author: Vinnie L.

description: Well, this place is a half block from me and what can I say?  Friendly staff, and delicious sandwiches at a great price.  Love it.
author: aaron f.

description: Five stars for having the good sense to be well-stocked with beer during the atrociousness that was the San Francisco "Street" Food Festival allowing us to drink tallboys out of paper bags to help alleviate our hunger and numb our disappointment.
author: Adam Z.

description: **0 stars, but guess that's not an option.** I had the most HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE experience here last week. I had a coupon from kgbdeals for this place (deli item voucher for $6), and, based on the great reviews, decided to try them out. So I show up on Thursday (May 12) at 9:10pm - the guy is super friendly, says 'Oh yes, we take these coupons, no problem, but the deli is closed, you need to come back another day before 9'. Fine, I am in the neighborhood again on Sunday (May 15) and stop by at 5pm. There are three people behind the counter, and the moment I offer my coupon, they start whispering among each other. The one who says he is the manager says that they would accept it at first, but then changes his mind and asks me to 'come back later when the owner is here'. I tell them that I was already there a few days ago and they get very confrontational and start challenging me and tell me that I am lying. I insist they call the owner, which they do after a lot of argument. This is the side of the conversation I hear - the 'manager': 'Hey, do we take those kgbdeals coupons?'; 'We do?'; 'What, so I will just hand out free sandwiches now, is that it?' Then he hangs up and says, 'Sorry, we can't take your coupon'. That's it, end of story. I ask to talk to the owner myself, and they refuse rudely. The whole time, everyone is super disrespectful and insulting, and treat me like I am a criminal. All the other reviews here can't seem to stop raving about how friendly and helpful 'Ray' is - so is he going to do anything about this? (I live in Oakland, so I am already out about $13 BART fare for my two trips to this place on top of what I paid for the coupon.)
author: Partha C.

description: Best. homemade. hummus.  EVER.  Really, the hummus is amazing - it comes with oil, herbs, and spicy stuff on top, and you mix it all together to make the most perfect goodness.  At $2.99, it's a steal.
author: N. S.

description: Their sandwiches are super generous with the meat and generally cost $4.5, under $6 if you throw in some avocado and/or cheese.  Plus, the special red onion, pepperoncini, and jalapeno sauce is damn tasty.  Moreover, they don't add an excessive CRV charge for Arizona Iced Tea tall boys--just $0.99, like it says on the can.  And they have a great selection of said cans, including the elusive Energy Tonic, my personal favorite.  Plus, the family that works there and probably owns the place are super friendly.  My expectations for a corner store are well exceeded.
author: Alan R.

description: This place rocks!! Owner is very cool and friendly!! The sandwiches are the best!! Great prices and fresh food!! Can't go wrong!! You definitely need to check out this place!! :) I will definitely be back soon!
author: Helen J.

description: 1st of all Ray the owner is the coolest shop owner in the history of marketdom. Secondly, try the Pastrami, I found it by accident. He's so good I just ask him to make whatever he feels like making. I've eaten about 20-25 of his sandwiches never knowing what i'll get till I get home. He's the Leonardo of sandwich culture!
author: Michael R.

description:
Just echoing what everyone said already. Great sandwiches for the price made with love by the affable owner. His son sometimes man's the register while watching football and their banter feels like being in a family's or friend's living room and kitchen. 

Altogether, the kind of small family business you may not believe exists in more cynical moments...
author: Charles D.

description:
This little market is at the corner of 25th, adjacent to big bad Garfield Park. The former owner had a filthy place and sold 40-ouncers to the homeless. About 4 months ago it was sold to a great guy who has brought a jewel to the neighborhood. Pluses:
1. Huge variety of wine, ports, champagne including 2 Buck Chuck and lots of Aussies. He always tells you when you buy a white wine if he has one chilled. He also has a punch card good for 1 freebie after 10 purchases.
2. Service - I bought a bunch of stuff for my St. Paddies party and he had his helper carry it home and into my kitchen for me. How often does that happen in SF?
3. Variety - he keeps some fresh stuff, but has lovely olives, capers, mustards, dressings and etceteras on the shelves with the staples at fair prices.
4. Deli - he makes a huge sandwich and piles on the meat for cheap, and he's fixing up a deli counter in the rear for Mid Eastern yummies.
5. Smiles - the owner is the greatest - always waves to me on my way to the bus, has fresh flowers, newspapers, and I have vowed to shop here at least once a week even if I don't need anything because this is the type of store that is giving the neighborhood back to the residents instead of the creeps on the street.

No minuses. Three cheers for R Image!
author: OffToRio B.

description: It's odd to leave a review for a convenience store, but my husband and I had such a nice experience at R that I had to. We were visiting San Francisco from out of town and popped into R to pick up a bottle of whiskey for our hosts. First, the place had a great selection. It's basically everything you'd want out of a convenience store, plus more. For example, it has a deli that serves Boar's Head meat. Love that stuff. And I remember feeling like there would have been plenty of bottles of wine to choose from, if we were buying that instead of whiskey. The real appeal, though, was talking to the guy who worked there. We talked to him for maybe 20 minutes about the store and life in San Francisco. You can just tell that this guy works hard, takes a lot of pride in his store, and cares about the customer service experience. You don't see that kind of enthusiasm and sincerity all that often. He's the exact kind of business owner you want in your community, and I wish I had an R in my neighborhood back home! If you're choosing between the tons of places to buy those everyday things in the Mission, pick these guys. They deserve your business.
author: Elena V.

description: There are a lack of nice, credit card accepting liquor stores in this part of the mission and this place fills that void.  The people are friendly and they have a good selection of beer and wine and an okay selection of liquor.  What more could you want?
author: Rob R.

description: Ray is wonderful. Let me get that out of the way first and foremost. I love the guy. He's personable, thoughtful and remembers his regular customers. There are also several young men who work there that are also quite wonderful. The usual young man behind the sandwich bar, with the glasses and dark hair, is sweet as pie and makes a damn good sandwich. The red-headed young man is also, always personable and funny. As for whom I take to be the youngest worker, the one with the brown hair and flat face, well, I'm pretty sure he is the spawn of satan. I have been coming to R Image for 3 years, and he never seems to remember me. He never smiles, and even though I am 30 years old, he asks for my ID every time. My fiance, however, he knows by name, and is friendly with. I've talked to him several times, asking why he feels the need to ID check me constantly, even though I'm in there three times a week. He pretends to be sorry, and sarcastically remarks he will remember me next time. Needless to say, he doesn't. Jerk. Tonight I stopped by for some food, and he short changed me by a dollar. I told him this, and he dismissed me completely and rudely. I'm kicking myself now for not being more forceful. It's a shame that I tend to hold grudges, but what's the point of going to a friendly, neighborhood market, if it's not friendly? Goodbye, R Image. I'm taking my champagne-addicted shopping habits elsewhere.
author: Jo B.

description: just one thing to add to the plusses - FALAFEL SANDWICH.  Yummy!  I finished it before I made it the 4 blocks home :)
author: Linda L.

description: Ray's fallafels are the best bang for the buck and quickest service in our 24th street neighborhood. We love to refer our production crews and client over there for lunch when we don't order for ourselvres. Ray takes phone call orders and his falafels are a perfect alternative to the pervasive burritos on 24th. Everybody loves them and they're delicious yet vegetarian which makes it easy for us to group order and make all happy. Go Ray !
author: Vic F.

description: The roast beef sammich was good, and was only 3.99. They could use some more choices of protein and add-ons, I think. Anyway, I was dismayed to see the same person making making me food without sanitary gloves collect my money afterwards. This is a distinct health-code violation. I wonder if he washed after I left, before going on to make more food items. YUK. They won't see me there again, ever.
author: masterful l.

description: This market is exactly what this neighborhood needed.  Unlike the other little stores around here,  R Image seems to carry a lot of interesting and useful groceries and everything is not overpriced.  They even have stuff like charcoal, cold medicine,  a selection of important produce items (that I always seem to run out of such as garlic, lemons, limes, potatoes, bananas & tomatoes), lots of gourmet & organic products, and a great selection of beer & wine.  They also have yummy sandwiches with vegetarian options!
author: j c.

description: this is the corner store from god... no joke....awsome samwiches and ray is freaking hilarious!!!! and they carry alot of stuff most little corner stores wont carrry(great beer selection) ......all i have to say is awsome!
author: Gabriel O.

description: This is the the best little sandwich shop and convenience store you could imagine.  I generally don't usually get this excited about deli sandwiches, but if you try one you'll know exactly where I'm coming from here, and they'd be well priced even for a sandwich of half the quality.  The owner Ray is a really friendly guy who connects with the locals and is a lot of fun to talk to.
author: Marcus P.
